messages.loginRestrictionsDesc: Within {interval} minutes, if password errors exceed {errorNum} times, lock account for {lockDuration} minutes.
messages.passwordPolicyDesc: Minimum password length {minLength} characters, password length range allowed is 6-50 characters.
messages.passwordPolicyRule: Password must contain at least two combinations from 'uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, special symbols', where special symbols include '-=[];\',./~!@#$%^&*()_+{}:"<>?'.
messages.registrationDesc: After enabling the registration code, users can register as users under the current account through invitation codes.
messages.accountCancellationDesc: Confirm that the account is no longer in use and can be cancelled. After system administrator confirmation, the account will be retained for 24 hours before being cleared. During the retention period, you can revoke the account cancellation. After cancellation, the account and all users under it will be unable to log in, and services and data will be deleted and cannot be recovered.
messages.cancellationModalDesc: The person cancelling must be a system administrator.
messages.sendVerificationCodeDesc: Send verification code to current user's mobile
messages.cancellationSuccess: Account cancelled successfully, will take effect in 24 hours

labels.passwordMustContain: Password must contain at least two combinations
labels.afterEnablingRegistrationCode: After enabling the registration code, users can register as users under the current account through invitation codes.
labels.confirmAccountNoLongerInUse: Confirm that the account is no longer in use and can be cancelled. After system administrator confirmation, the account will be retained for 24 hours before being cleared. During the retention period, you can revoke the account cancellation. After cancellation, the account and all users under it will be unable to log in, and services and data will be deleted and cannot be recovered.
labels.personCancellingMustBeAdmin: The person cancelling must be a system administrator.
labels.sendVerificationCodeToCurrentUserMobile: Send verification code to current user's mobile

messages.quotaRangeTip: If you have requirements for extending resource quotas, you can
messages.contactEngineer: contact the ticket engineer to help you process!

messages.description: Event templates are classifications of events. Through event templates, you can configure different receiving channels for different types of events. After configuration, when events occur, they will be automatically sent to the corresponding template's event channels. For business events, you can also configure events in Application Management.

Event records are system and business critical states collected by applications during runtime, such as: task status changes, quota and resource shortages, major errors or exceptions, security alerts, etc. In addition to viewing events in the current event records, you can also associate event channels with event templates. After association, events will be automatically pushed to corresponding event channels. If the event template does not configure receiving channels, event notifications will not be triggered.

placeholder.inputWeChatAddress: Please enter WeChat Enterprise robot address

messages.maxWebhook: Maximum 5 webhook addresses can be added
messages.maxEmail: Maximum 20 email addresses can be added
messages.maxDingTalk: Maximum 10 DingTalk robots can be added
messages.maxWeChat: Maximum 10 WeChat Enterprise robots can be added

titles.webhookTitle: Webhook is the HTTP callback address you use to receive event content. By associating pre-defined webhook addresses in event templates, when events occur, the system will send events to corresponding webhook addresses via HTTP protocol POST requests. Maximum 5 webhook addresses are allowed.
titles.emailTitle: Email groups are user email groups you use to receive events. By associating pre-defined email groups in event templates, when events occur, the system will send emails to corresponding email group mailboxes. Maximum 20 email groups are allowed.
titles.dingTalkTitle: DingTalk robots are DingTalk message groups you use to receive events. For DingTalk robot configuration, please refer to DingTalk product documentation. By associating pre-defined DingTalk robots in event templates, when events occur, the system will send events to corresponding DingTalk robot message groups. Maximum 10 DingTalk robots are allowed.
titles.weChatTitle: WeChat Enterprise robots are WeChat Enterprise message groups you use to receive events. For WeChat Enterprise robot configuration, please refer to WeChat Enterprise product documentation. By associating pre-defined WeChat Enterprise robots in event templates, when events occur, the system will send events to corresponding WeChat Enterprise robot message groups. Maximum 10 WeChat Enterprise robots are allowed.

steps.dingTalkStep1: Add robot to DingTalk group, select 'Custom' for robot type.
steps.dingTalkStep2: In security settings, check keyword, the entered name should correspond to the added name, e.g., if DingTalk robot keyword is 'Test Report', then the robot name added on the page should be 'Test Report'.
steps.dingTalkStep3: If security level has requirements, security settings can check signature. This is not mandatory.
steps.dingTalkStep4: Copy the webhook address and signature of DingTalk robot.
steps.dingTalkStep5: Paste the name (DingTalk keyword), address (DingTalk webhook address), signature (DingTalk signature) into 'DingTalk Robot Configuration', click [Test] [Save].

messages.description: Real-time recording of user operations and resource change information on the system; through operation logs, you can achieve security analysis, resource change tracking, and abnormal problem positioning. Logs are saved by default for {days} days.
View access request logs for "User Tokens" and "System Tokens". Records are saved for {clearBeforeDay} days by default.

messages.tip: The currently generated access token (access_token) is a "System" access token, used for system-to-system API calls in scenarios where users do not exist (such as other CI systems or development systems, etc.); To ensure security, it is recommended to create and authorize different system tokens for different external systems; All access operations and audit information of system access tokens will be associated with corresponding request logs; Only system administrators are allowed to create, delete, and view system tokens.
messages.limitTime: Expiration Time (default valid for 30 days if not specified)
messages.supportMaxNum: Support adding up to {n} system access tokens

messages.channelDescribe1: SMS channels define SMS service provider information. Configuring SMS channels can be used to send reminders, verifications, or warning messages via SMS, such as SMS verification codes, security alerts, etc. The system provides Alibaba Cloud and Huawei Cloud SMS channels by default.
messages.channelDescribe3: Search and install, or through plugin mechanism
messages.enablePromptContent: After this SMS channel is enabled, other enabled SMS channels will be disabled. Confirm to enable this SMS channel?
messages.disabledPromptContent: Disabling SMS channels will cause SMS triggered by system business to fail to send to users. Confirm to disable this SMS channel?

messages.mailboxTip: Email servers are used by the system to send emails, such as email verification codes during registration, security alert emails, business processing notifications, etc. A maximum of 10 email servers are allowed to be configured, and when there are multiple servers, only the email server set as 'default' will take effect.

messages.appStorageDesc: Application data storage paths are specified by users during installation. Modifying paths requires manual configuration file changes and restart to take effect.
messages.businessStorageDesc: Configure application business file data storage location. Modifying paths will result in loss of historical data. Please backup and migrate historical data before modification to prevent data loss.

messages.description: Configuring LDAP can synchronize entries (users, group membership relationships) from your directory service to the current system. After configuring LDAP directory service, the system will automatically synchronize every 5 minutes according to the order of enabled LDAP directory services. To ensure that deletion of entries in the directory does not affect business data integrity, automatic synchronization and the 'Synchronize' and 'Delete Directory' operations in the operation column below will not delete users and groups already synchronized in the current system by default, only group and user membership relationships will be deleted. If you want to delete users and groups that do not exist in the directory, you can manually delete them in 'Global Management' - 'Organization Personnel', or delete all through 'Delete Directory and Data' in the operation column below. A maximum of 10 LDAP directory services can be configured.
messages.testFailed: Test failed (please check the content format on this page)
messages.serverNameTip: LDAP service name, no duplicates allowed, such as: MyOpenLDAP.
messages.hostTip: Hostname of the server running LDAP. For example: ldap.example.com
messages.usernameTip: User account for logging into LDAP. For example: cn=user, dc=domain, dc=name
messages.verifySslTip: Verify SSL certificate for this connection
messages.baseDnTip: Root node for searching users and groups from LDAP. For example: cn=users,dc=example,dc=com
messages.userDnTip: Search scope limitation for users based on base DN
messages.groupDnTip: Search scope limitation for groups based on base DN
messages.groupObjectClassTip: LDAP group object class type to use when searching groups, for example: posixGroup.
messages.groupFilterTip: Filter conditions used when searching group objects, for example: (objectclass=posixGroup).
messages.groupNameAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to group name, for example: cn.
messages.groupDescAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to group description, for example: givenName.
messages.memberAttrTip: Attribute field to use when searching users from groups, for example: memberUid.
messages.memberGroupAttrTip: Attribute field to use when searching groups from users, for example: gidNumber.
messages.userObjectClassTip: LDAP user object class type to use when searching users, for example: posixAccount.
messages.userFilterTip: Filter conditions used when searching user objects, for example: (objectclass=posixAccount).
messages.userUidAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user unique name, for example: uid.
messages.userFirstNameAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user first name, for example: givenName.
messages.userLastNameAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user last name, for example: sn.
messages.userMobileAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user mobile number, for example: mobile
messages.userEmailAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user email, for example: mail.
messages.userPasswordAttrTip: Attribute field corresponding to user unique name, for example: userPassword.
messages.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete LDAP service 【{name}】?
messages.ignoreSameNameGroupTip: When there are corresponding group names, ignore the current directory group (if not ignored when duplicated, there will be two groups with the same name)
messages.displayNameTip: Attribute field corresponding to user full name or nickname, for example: cn.
messages.ignoreSameIdentityUserTip: Force ignore when there are users with the same unique identifier (username, email, mobile number)
messages.userSyncSuccess: User synchronization successful, total users: {total}, added: {new}, updated: {update}, deleted: {delete}, ignored: {ignore}.
messages.groupSyncSuccess: Group synchronization successful, total groups: {total}, added: {new}, updated: {update}, deleted: {delete}, ignored: {ignore}.
messages.memberSyncSuccess: Group member synchronization successful, total members: {total}, added: {new}, updated: {update}, deleted: {delete}, ignored: {ignore}.

labels.name: Name
labels.ignoreSameNameGroup: Whether to ignore when there are groups with the same name
labels.ignoreSameIdentityUser: Whether to ignore when there are users with the same identity
